comments.body: cc [~ctang.ma]

[~q79969786]: Could you please add a test case? How can we reproduce the isseu?

Thanks,

Peter

Seeing similar error. We're on Hive 2.3.2 we've only seen it in a table with 2 partition columns.

The client side stacktrace is (Just in case someone Googles that (like me :))):
{noformat}

[~pvary] I have written a unit test which reproduces the issue, it fails on the existing 2.3.2 code and passes with the attached patch applied. How best should I contribute this? As a combined patch of the above fix and the new tests as an attachment to this ticket? As a pull request in GitHub? Something else?
[~massdosage@gmail.com], attach another patch to this ticket that includes the test.

[~massdosage@gmail.com]: Thanks for working on this. Is the failure reproducible on master branch as well? Please attach a patch file with the test and the fix as described here: [https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HowToContribute#HowToContribute-CreatingaPatch]

In nutshell:
 * Create a patch file
 * Attach the patch file
 * Set the status of the Jira to "Patch available"
 * See the results of the test after the Pre-Commit tests finishes

Thanks again!

Peter
[~pvary] doesn't it need to be assigned to someone before the status can be set to "patch available"? Should I assign it to myself? You? Someone else?
[~massdosage@gmail.com]: Yeah, it should be assigned to you. [~teabot] already done that :D

Could someone please code review this? Hopefully it's fairly trivial. The code in question had no tests at all so I added more than are strictly necessary for this change but thought it was better this way. Perhaps [~pvary]?

We have reproduced this in Hive 2.3.2 which the above fix is for. I see the code affected is no longer there (moved?) in master (targeting 3.0.0) but I'm not sure if this code has just been moved elsewhere and this fix and the tests should be moved there too.

[~massdosage@gmail.com]: LGTM pending tests. If possible would you mind to add javadoc to the {{isFastStatsSame}} method? For me it is a little counter intuitive that if any of the stats are not set, then the method returns false even if the stats are empty on both new and the old partition. Checked the usages, and I kinda suspect that this is the intended usage, but would be nice to highlight it in a comment.

 

Thanks,

Peter

Yes, the behaviour of the method is definitely counter-intuitive but I didn't want to make any changes other than what was altered in the original patch without the tests. I'll do my best to add some javadoc describing what it currently does and add another patch.
I notice that the tests have not run on this patch. Does the issue need to be updated in any way for this to happen?

If a contributor notices this they can resubmit the same patch with a different name.
Committers can retrigger the run on the jenkins job without adding a new patch. I did this for this jira, so we will have the test results soon (or not too soon:) )
[~pvary] - looks like the tests aren't running. Is there anything you can do? Or should I put a post on the Hive dev list and ask for help there?
Tried to start the pre-commit again

ATTACHMENT ID: 12916808 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

[~pvary] thanks for kicking that off, it ran but the build is failing when applying the patch. I think it's trying to apply the patch to master which is Hive 3.x while the patch is intended for Hive 2.3.x. I saw the code had moved around in 3.x so it makes sense that it can't apply it to master. [~pvary] how do we proceed if we want this applied to Hive 2.x?
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HowToContribute#HowToContribute-CreatingaPatch
Ah, OK, I missed the bit about including the branch name in the patch file name, let me try again.

OK, I have renamed patch to "HIVE-18767-branch-2.3.patch". The documentation on branches in the Wiki is out of date but "branch-2.3" looks the most likely candidate for where the next 2.3 release will be coming from. Please correct me if I'm wrong. I did a fresh checkout of that branch and ensured that the patch applies cleanly:
{code}
patch -p0 --dry-run < ../HIVE-18767-branch-2.3.patch 
checking file metastore/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/metastore/MetaStoreUtils.java
checking file metastore/src/test/org/apache/hadoop/hive/metastore/TestMetaStoreUtils.java
{code}
So hopefully we're good to go.

[~pvary] I have added patches as follows:

HIVE-18767-branch-2.3.patch -> Ieft that as is, the code appears to be present in the branch so I'm not sure how it didn't make it into 2.3.3 but hopefully having it here will mean it would make it into 2.3.4 (if this is ever released)
HIVE-18767-branch-2.patch -> I have added this, it's pretty much the same as above, just on a different branch.

HIVE-18767/HIVE-18767-branch-3.patch -> added, pretty much the same as above
HIVE-18767.5.patch -> added, this is for master. The code has moved to a new class, the change is the same here. The tests however were quite different as someone had actually added a test for the method. I made quite a few changes to the test - I renamed the test class to match the fact that the class under test has also changed name; I removed the static imports of the methods under test as some tests were using the fully qualified class name and some weren't - I prefer consistency and also think using the full class name is more clear to show where the test methods are; finally I replaced the new test with the set of tests that I added in my previous patches as I think it's clearer to have a test for each condition rather than munging them all into one test and these tests run really quickly.

Could you please help with getting these merged where appropriate? If there is anything else I can to do ensure these changes actually go into a future release that would be great as we'd really like this change in a production version so we can remove workarounds on our side.
